<topcClas>Family life and marriage - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>         <topcClas>Use and provision of specific social services - Social welfare policy and systems</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>This material formed the basis for Professor Townsend's classic 1954-55 study which examined the growing perception that a breakdown in extended family networks was leaving old people isolated, and creating an increasing demand for residential care. Based primarily on interviews with a random sample of 203 people of pensionable age living in Bethnal Green, East London, the project demonstrated the important role that kinship networks, and relations within the extended family, played in the maintenance of community membership. This collection comprises PDF copies of Townsend's original papers, which are well-written, journalistic summaries of his face-to-face interviews, including his own observations and descriptions. 178 of the interview summaries are included in this collection (including kinship diagrams), several diaries, and 11 summaries of pilot interviews (made in 1954) with elderly people in Hampstead and Westminster.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Old age; elderly people; family life; housing for the elderly; care of dependants; welfare services; community life; retirement; poverty; social isolation; loneliness.<br> </abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="1865-01-01T00:00:00Z">1865</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="1955-01-01T00:00:00Z">1955</timePrd>         <collDate event="start" date="1954-01-01T00:00:00Z">1954</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="1955-01-01T00:00:00Z">1955</collDate>         <nation>England</nation>         <geogCover>Bethnal Green</geogCover>         <geogCover>Hampstead</geogCover>         <geogCover>Westminster</geogCover>         <geogCover>Greater London</geogCover>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>Subnational</universe>         <universe>Elderly men and women in Bethnal Green, Hampstead and Westminster, London.</universe>         <dataKind>Textual data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>         <dataKind>Interview summaries</dataKind>         <dataKind> Kinship diagrams</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Townsend, P., Institute of Community Studies</dataCollector>         <dataCollector>Marris, P., Institute of Community Studies</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Quota sample</sampProc>         <deviat>189</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview;
